heading: melissa maker nabbed
subheading: new jersey state police, along with the fbi's new infrastructure defense division, on thursday arrested a man they say is the author of the melissa virus.
author: wired news report
text: mellisa is a man from new jersey. authorities on thursday night arrested aberdeen resident david smith, 30, for writing and propogating the notorious melissa virus.the federal bureau of investigation's national infrastructure protection center confirmed the arrest -- the first major action for the new organization. agents worked with new jersey state police to track smith down.the melissa virus first surfaced on 26 march after it was posted to a usenet news group in the alt.sex hierarchy inside an infected microsoft word file. melissa is a word macro virus which appears to affect only users of microsoft outlook, an email program.earlier this week, two researchers reported that they had tracked the virus to its creator, an individual who goes by the alias vicodines.authorities will discuss their search at a press conference at 1 p.m. est friday, an fbi representative said.full story to follow.
